Basically, you can't. We call this feature "mirror detection" and it  
is very much a work in progress at this point.

For the common case where x.com is the same as www.x.com, there are  
URL canonicalization rules that will translate things like http:// 
www.x.com/foo into http://x.com/foo; these rules are part of the  
default order.xml, so your crawls are probably already taking  
advantage of this.

See:

org.archive.crawler.url.canonicalize.StripWWWRule
org.archive.crawler.url.canonicalize.StripWWWNRule

-Paul
